Title: Calculus 2
Subject: MST
Description: Techniques of integration, indeterminate forms, improper integrals, transcendental functions, sequences, Taylorâ€™s formula, and infinite series, including power series. Lab

Title: Discrete Math
Subject: MST
Description: Introduction to various topics in discrete mathematics applicable to computer science including sets, relations, Boolean algebra, propositional logic, functions, computability, proof techniques, graph theory, and elementary combinatorics.

Title: Linear Algebra
Subject: MST
Description: Vectors and vector spaces, linear transformations and matrices, determinants, eigenvalues, and eigenvectors. Credit not allowed for both 121 and 205. Lab.

Title: Introduction to Linear Algebra and Differential Equations
Subject: MST
Description: Specific topics covered include: vector algebra, solving linear systems of equations, rank, vector spaces, determinants, eigenvalues, linear transformations, first order differential equations, second order linear ordinary differential equations, and power series solutions to differential equations.

Title: Applied Matrix Algebra and Selected Topics
Subject: MST
Description: Matrices, determinants, solutions of linear equations, special matrices, eigenvalues and eigenvectors of matrices. Additional topics will be covered as time permits. Not to be counted toward any major offered by the department except for the major in mathematical business.
